pageContext.claim: ““If thinking that James Comey is not a good FBI Director is tantamount to being an agent of Russia, than just list all the people that are agents of Russia - Chuck Schumer, Nancy Pelosi, Rod Rosenstein who wrote the memo to get rid of Comey, the Inspector General....” Trey Gowdy”
pageContext.analysis: The FBI did not open a counterintelligence investigation into President Trump solely because he fired James B. Comey. Rather, it was the president’s actions before and after the former FBI director’s dismissal that prompted the inquiry. Ahead of the firing, there was serious concern about Trump’s tone toward Comey. Then, after the firing, Trump admitted his action was because of the Russia investigation, and told Russian officials that he had faced “great pressure because of Russia” that was relieved by Comey’s dismissal. In the same conversation, he called Comey a “real nut job.”
